snippet: The view that President Obama could continue borrowing without Congressional authorization is based on three arguments: presidential power, a provision of the 14th Amendment and constitutional obligations.
abstract: News analysis; some law professors say Pres Obama has options should Congress fail to raise nation's debt ceiling; view that he could continue borrowing without Congressional authorization is based on three arguments: aggressive understanding of presidential power, interpretation of obscure provision of the 14th Amendment and choice among three irreconcilable constitutional obligations.
lead_paragraph: The view that President Obama could continue borrowing without Congressional authorization is based on three arguments: presidential power, a provision of the 14th Amendment and constitutional obligations.

headline.main: Experts See Potential Ways Out for Obama in Debt Ceiling Maze
